issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() as returning int, while the template comment and the reference solution expect/implement a double return type. This creates ambiguity for students: should they implement getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() to return an int (as the UML shows) or a double (as the template hint and solution do)? The discrepancy can lead to compilation errors if students follow one artifact and the tests expect the other, or to confusion about the intended precision of the result.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent across all artifacts. Recommended: update the problem statement UML/signature to declare getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor(): double (and mention in the textual description that a double is expected for precise calculation), so it matches the template hint and the solution. Alternatively, if an integer result is intended, change the template comment and the solution method to return int and update tests/documentation accordingly.
